TopicTitle: Did we find all of the easter eggs yet?

Articles.Content:
Look at his second post. There is still hope!

Yay!

But like I said, my rover can't get any traction, so I can't search for it...

I'm looking at minmus' data file right here, all I see is the one monolith we already know about.

so what caused it?(my game is spetial:P)

-snip-

Read his second post

Yay!

But like I said, my rover can't get any traction, so I can't search for it...

That's why you use the before .19 rovers to find it. They were the only ones that worked well on Minmus!

Actually my copy hasn't been updated in a while, gimme a bit and I'll check again.

Still nothing.

Still nothing.

OK, so we know it's not an Easter Egg. So, HOW DO WE EXPLAIN THAT DARN CRATER?!

OK, so we know it's not an Easter Egg. So, HOW DO WE EXPLAIN THAT DARN CRATER?!

That was previously stated on this very thread. it's a lighting thing.

That was previously stated on this very thread. it's a lighting thing.

But it still doesn't appear in the tracking station and he can't switch to it. It's an undocumented easter egg, just like the Moho fairies! Did someone check that out?

just to describe exactly the missing icons are unrelated the crater is a shadow and the pod acts like terrain scatter even though said is off.

EDIT:thanks for the help Nova.

Edited June 5, 2013 by Spartwo

But it still doesn't appear in the tracking station and he can't switch to it. It's an undocumented easter egg, just like the Moho fairies! Did someone check that out?

Actually Nova just told us that it wasn't an easter egg.

@spartwo: it could be a feature using terrain scatter that when terrain is loaded there is a very small chance that a cockpit is placed.

I assume you mean 37.15.46W, in which case Jeb is there right now in my save and he cannot find the command pod.

EDIT: nevermind, it's clearly a different location than the one in the picture.

Checked there, didn't find anything:

Edit: Darn forgot to refresh before posting, someone beat me to it.

Edited June 5, 2013 by Mr. Generic
Who's seen the "Face in the Moon"? It's that creepy line drawing of a guy with a chin tilted off to the right and a big grin.

Who's seen the "Face in the Moon"? It's that creepy line drawing of a guy with a chin tilted off to the right and a big grin.

You mean Carl Sagan?

You mean Carl Sagan?

No, it's the Troll Face, and it's on the Mun.
Pictures please

No, it's the Troll Face, and it's on the Mun.
It was an April fools joke from the MechJeb team.

No, it's the Troll Face, and it's on the Mun.

Screenshot? WITHOUT the Trollface just plastered on there?
I'm having some problems relocating the munolith north of KSC. Not the one immediately north but the one around 100km+ north of it, has any one else found it in .20?

That creepy line drawing of a guy with a chin tilted off to the right and a big grin.

That's the best description of a Trollface ever!
No one has found the teapot orbiting Kerbol between Kerbin and Duna yet.

Definitely not all of the surprises can be directly found via MapSat's anomaly button. The =D trenches in the ocean south of KSC are proof of that. I only just discovered it after the new dev version of MapSat included a zoom function and it's apparantly been there for awhile.

Do you guys remember the large tractor tread marks on Minmus? Are they still there? I was never able to find them myself and I can't find the original picture of them.

Edit: NVM I found them. Here is the original post

Recently I've found something that looked peculiarly similar to giant track prints on Minmus.

Signs of alien activity, perhaps?

The small figure at the lower right of the last picture is Bill (or maybe Bob).

Edited June 6, 2013 by AmpsterMan

No one has found the teapot orbiting Kerbol between Kerbin and Duna yet.

what? what is this amazing thing you speak of?

what? what is this amazing thing you speak of?

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russell's_teapot

I propose that the cockpit is just a very, very rare terrain scatter. Rare terrain scatters would be impossible to find with Mapsat as their location is random. If it can't be found in map view or switched to, it's a scatter. The only proof we need now is for someone to find it again and see if it has a collider. Also, notice that the cockpit's texture is slightly lower than the rover's.
